image.altText: Outside the ACT Fire and Rescue South Tuggeranong.

props.synopsis: The baby — estimated to be less than 24 hours old — was found this morning outside a fire station.

title.children: Police concerned for mother after newborn baby found outside fire station

image.altText: Two people wearing dark blue scrubs walk away from the camera through a modern-looking hospital building.

props.synopsis: They were treated as "heroes and angels" during the pandemic years, but the number of occupational violence incidents against healthcare workers and staff working in Canberra's Health Services is steadily increasing, new documents reveal.

title.children: Increase in occupational violence against health staff and nurses

image.altText: A CEO with dark hair, glasses, looking serious.

props.synopsis: The federal government will expand a "lifeline" service for survivors of sexual violence, which advocates say is fully booked.

title.children: 'As traumatic as the assault': Expansion of sexual violence legal services

image.altText: A brown silo with the words Tarago written on it, with a street in its background

props.synopsis: Farmers near Tarago in southern New South Wales fear a proposed waste-to-energy incinerator could threaten their health and livelihoods.

title.children: Sydney's rubbish leaves farmers feeling like 'second-class citizens'

image.altText: A woman with curly hair and glasses smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The university paid the former vice-chancellor a severance package of more than $400,000 in income and superannuation.

title.children: Former ANU boss Genevieve Bell receives $400,000 exit pay

image.altText: Radford College

props.synopsis: Financial errors are being blamed for one school being hundreds of thousands of dollars in debt and hiking school fees by 23 per cent.

title.children: 'We will not allow our kids to be thrown under the bus because of bad governance'

image.altText: A red and yellow striped balloon in the air with clouds around it.

props.synopsis: Hot air balloon rides are nearly 10 times riskier than a joy flight in a light plane or a helicopter, a new report by the national transport safety investigator has found.

title.children: Hot air balloon rides nearly 10 times riskier as helicopter or plane

image.altText: A split-screen image of a man and a woman, both wearing National Guard uniforms.

props.synopsis: Authorities identify the two National Guard members shot just blocks from the White House, as the FBI carries out searches of two properties on the US west coast.

title.children: Troops critically injured in Washington shooting named as FBI launches terror probe

image.altText: Environment Minister Murray Watt walks in the Senate.

props.synopsis: The environmental deal is a major win for a government whose critics on the left are calling for it to be more reformist.

title.children: Greens out-step flat-footed Liberals on crucial deal

image.altText: A teenager looks down at a smartphone screen displaying the Snapchat logo, a yellow screen with a white ghost cartoon

props.synopsis: As the social media ban for kids under 16 approaches, popular messaging app Snapchat says young people will be able to verify their age by sending a selfie or their ID to a third-party platform, but sharing sensitive data carries risks.

title.children: Cybersecurity experts alarmed by Snapchat's age-verification plan

image.altText: A woman with long, dark hair sits in a dimly-lit room.

props.synopsis: A major review into preventing violence against women and children called for changes to immediate alcohol home delivery

title.children: Ministers must answer for inaction on alcohol laws, anti-DV advocates say

image.altText: A shopper carrying a bag walks past a shop in Perth's city centre

props.synopsis: As scammers look to exploit sales during Black Friday and Cyber Monday we explain what you need to know to avoid being duped.

title.children: How to spot a scam during Black Friday and Cyber Monday

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin suggests he is open to developing a new agreement, but says Russia will continue fighting if no deal is struck.

title.children: Putin says US plan could be 'basis' for end to Ukraine war

image.altText: Large rectangular slabs of rock with water from a river entering from one side in which people are swimming in.

props.synopsis: From 'Pondi' to Sydney Harbour, here's when your popular spots will reopen.

title.children: New-look Sydney swimming spots reopening so you can beat the heat

image.altText: Frozen Elsa Disney pic

props.synopsis: It wasn't just a box office success — Frozen introduced a new type of Disney princess: one who was strong, flawed and uninterested in romance.

title.children: Twelve years ago, Frozen flipped the script on the Disney princess narrative

image.altText: A woman stands in a party with her eyes closed as confetti rains down on her.

props.synopsis: November saw the return of two beloved franchises; magic-filled Now You See Me and action classic Predator — but can either live up to their predecessors?

title.children: Movie magic and manic mothers: Here's what's in cinemas this month

image.altText: an outback pub with a sign walkabout crek hotel a young family stand under the sign, two parents, two kids

props.synopsis: Think you’ve had your ears to the ground? It’s time to test your knowledge of the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: The G20 summit, a cyclone and a very famous pub

image.altText: A graphic of anonymous mum and two boys, in front of a home, all sepia toned.

props.synopsis: Two women who fled their violent partners say their efforts to stay in emergency accommodation via state government housing offices left them "deeply traumatised".

title.children: Minister admonishes department for treatment of DV victim-survivors

image.altText: Two police officers take notes while talking to an unidentified woman.

props.synopsis: The standalone legislation — named in memory of Brisbane mother Hannah Clarke, who was murdered alongside her three children by her estranged husband in 2020 — came into effect in May.

title.children: More than 50 coercive control charges laid in six months since criminalisation

image.altText: Middle-aged man wearing dark t-shirt smiling at the camera holding a surfboard

props.synopsis: Shark attack survivors rally after a bull shark kills a woman and injures a man on the NSW mid north coast, warning of a nasty online backlash.

title.children: Global network of shark attack survivors connects after latest incident

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt and glasses standing at a train station holding a free travel voucher

props.synopsis: A promised month of free travel on the Gippsland Line in Victoria's east prompts complaints from some passengers, with even a V/Line staff member unsure of how the system works.

title.children: Victorian free travel scheme sparks confusion as commuters report mixed messages

image.altText: Sophie Devine of the Scorchers hits a cut shot to the off side during a WBBL match

props.synopsis: Perth have survived a dramatic collapse to beat the Melbourne Renegades by four wickets, denying the Renegades a share of top spot on the WBBL ladder.

title.children: Scorchers survive collapse to deny Renegades share of WBBL ladder lead

image.altText: A large brick building with the roof beams exposed after the roof was torn off in a storm.

props.synopsis: A storm that hit a tiny rural NSW town, damaging one in 10 homes, is psychologically draining for residents.

title.children: Storm carnage leaves town wondering 'what has it done to the world'

image.altText: An Asian baby boy sitting on high chair while eating. Baby boy is being fed by mother at home

props.synopsis: Allergen starter kits promise to make introducing foods to babies easier, but experts are concerned they may not be effective.

title.children: Allergen starter packs are meant to take the load off parents. But do they?

image.altText: Prabhjeet Gill wears a turban and has a beard

props.synopsis: A student paramedic who accused Ambulance Victoria of discrimination on the grounds of race and religion is "ecstatic" to have won his battle to allow cultural beards on the job.

title.children: Student paramedic wins battle with Ambulance Victoria over beard policy

image.altText: Barnaby Joyce speaking in the House of Representatives pointing behind him with his thumb.

props.synopsis: The former leader and deputy prime minister has confirmed his long-awaited political move.

title.children: Barnaby Joyce quits Nationals, will sit as independent

image.altText: A house with a sign out front reading the Embassy of the Islamic Republic of Iran with the country's flag on a pole

props.synopsis: The Iranian Government has condemned Australia's formal listing of its Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as a state sponsor of terrorism as "offensive and unjustified", accusing the Albanese government of doing Israel's bidding.

title.children: 'Offensive': Iran condemns Australia's listing of IRGC as sponsor of terrorism

image.altText: Murray Watt

props.synopsis: In his deal with the Greens, Environment Minister Murray Watt has just scraped off one of the biggest barnacles clinging to parliament.

title.children: Murray Watt has just cemented his reputation as a 'fixer'

image.altText: A digital rendering of the inside of a stadium with an AFL match underway.

props.synopsis: An expert planning panel has defended their scathing assessment of Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium while speaking to the politicians who will ultimately decide the project's fate.

title.children: Economic case for Hobart stadium just doesn't add up, experts say

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and a man in a blue shirt look at the camera

props.synopsis: Laura Stokes and Adam Zerna describe spending time in an underground bunker as the category three cyclone passed over, before emerging to find an "apocalyptic" scene.

title.children: Caretakers huddled in bunker as ‘apocalyptic’ Cyclone Fina hit luxury lodge

image.altText: Donald Trump looks serious has he wears a dark suit and stands inside an aicraft.

props.synopsis: The decision comes hours after US President Donald Trump said he was confident the suspect behind the shooting of two National Guard soldiers in Washington was from Afghanistan.

title.children: US stops processing immigration requests from Afghan nationals

image.altText: Housing under construction, worker climbing frames, wears shorts, white tee and hat, has tools belt around waist.

props.synopsis: Major housing, renewables and mining projects often get bogged down for years by Australia's aging environment laws. Now a deal to rewrite them could change that.

title.children: Waits on housing and renewables may have just gone from years to months

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiles as she hold a wrapped present while standing in front of a mural.

props.synopsis: The jury has been played a a covert recording of a conversation Rajwinder Singh had with an undercover officer in a police station cell in 2023.

title.children: Man accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley told police he saw 'killers' and 'ran'

image.altText: A man poses with his fist

props.synopsis: An emotional court hearing has been told the pain felt by the family of Min and Steven Cho after they were killed by a martial arts instructor almost two years ago.

title.children: Taekwondo instructor unable to explain why he killed three people

image.altText: Beach signage with police tape across pathway

props.synopsis: One woman is dead and a man is in a critical condition after a shark attack at Crowdy Bay on the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: 'Courage from bystanders' praised after woman killed in shark attack
